params.rootToken: address of token on root chain. Since rename token was introduced later stage,  clean method is used to clean pollulated mapping

params.user: address of account that should receive WETH on child chain

depositFor(address,address,bytes).details: This mechanism supports arbitrary tokens as long as its predicate has been registered and the token is mapped

params.depositData: bytes data that is sent to predicate and child token contracts to handle deposit
params.rootToken: address of token that is being deposited
params.user: address of account that should receive this deposit on child chain

exit(bytes).details: This function verifies if the transaction actually happened on child chain the transaction log is then sent to token predicate to handle it accordingly

params.inputData: RLP encoded data of the reference tx containing following list of fields 0 - headerNumber - Checkpoint header block number containing the reference tx 1 - blockProof - Proof that the block header (in the child chain) is a leaf in the submitted merkle root 2 - blockNumber - Block number containing the reference tx on child chain 3 - blockTime - Reference tx block time 4 - txRoot - Transactions root of block 5 - receiptRoot - Receipts root of block 6 - receipt - Receipt of the reference transaction 7 - receiptProof - Merkle proof of the reference receipt 8 - branchMask - 32 bits denoting the path of receipt in merkle tree 9 - receiptLogIndex - Log Index to read from the receipt

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive.     * Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point.     * WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`.     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

initialize(address).details: meant to be called once immediately after deployment

params._owner: the account that should be granted admin role

params.childToken: address of token on child chain
params.rootToken: address of token on root chain
params.tokenType: bytes32 unique identifier for the token type

registerPredicate(bytes32,address).details: A predicate is a contract responsible to process the token specific logic while locking or exiting tokens

params.tokenType: bytes32 unique identifier for the token type

params.childToken: address of token on child chain
params.rootToken: address of token on root chain
params.tokenType: bytes32 unique identifier for the token type

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account.     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).     * If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`.     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.     * Requirements:     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setCheckpointManager(address).details: This should be the plasma contract responsible for keeping track of checkpoints

setChildChainManagerAddress(address).details: This should be the contract responsible to receive deposit bytes on child chain

params.newChildChainManager: address of child chain manager contract

setStateSender(address).details: This should be the state sender from plasma contracts It is used to send bytes from root to child chain

checkpointManagerAddress().notice: Get the address of contract set as checkpoint manager

depositEtherFor(address).notice: Move ether from root to child chain, accepts ether transfer Keep in mind this ether cannot be used to pay gas on child chain Use Matic tokens deposited using plasma mechanism for that

depositFor(address,address,bytes).notice: Move tokens from root to child chain

initialize(address).notice: Initialize the contract after it has been proxified

mapToken(address,address,bytes32).notice: Map a token to enable its movement via the PoS Portal, callable only by mappers

registerPredicate(bytes32,address).notice: Register a token predicate address against its type, callable only by mappers

remapToken(address,address,bytes32).notice: Remap a token that has already been mapped, properly cleans up old mapping Callable only by mappers

setCheckpointManager(address).notice: Set the checkpoint manager, callable only by admins

setChildChainManagerAddress(address).notice: Set the child chain manager, callable only by admins

setStateSender(address).notice: Set the state sender, callable only by admins

stateSenderAddress().notice: Get the address of contract set as state sender
